## Z scores 

```{r}
x_vec <- rnorm(25, mean = 5, sd=4)

(x_vec - mean(x_vec)) / sd(x_vec)

z_scores = function(x) {
  
  z = (x-mean(x)) / sd(x)
  
  return(z)
}

z_scores(x = x_vec)


y_vec <- rnorm(40, mean = 12, sd=0.3)
z_scores(y_vec)

```

How great is this? 

only kinda great 

```{r, error = TRUE}
z_scores(3)

z_scores(c("my", "name", "is", "kaila"))

z_scores(mtcars)
```

try again 
```{r, error = TRUE}
z_scores = function(x) { 
  if(!is.numeric(x)) { 
    stop("x needs to be numeric")
  }
  
  if(length(x) < 3) { 
    stop("x should have at least 3 numbers")
  }
}

z_scores(mtcars)
```

```{r}

mean_and_sd = function(x) {
  
  if (!is.numeric(x)) {
    stop("Argument x should be numeric")
  } else if (length(x) == 1) {
    stop("Cannot be computed for length 1 vectors")
  }
  
  mean_x = mean(x)
  sd_x = sd(x)

  list(mean = mean_x, 
       sd = sd_x)
}


mean_and_sd = function(x) {
  
  if (!is.numeric(x)) {
    stop("Argument x should be numeric")
  } else if (length(x) == 1) {
    stop("Cannot be computed for length 1 vectors")
  }
  
  mean_x = mean(x)
  sd_x = sd(x)

  tibble(
    mean = mean_x, 
    sd = sd_x
  )
}

```
